column4: hi, i'm using a laptop with a dual graphics card in it, but the secondary screen isn't always liked, does anyone have an idea about setting up dual graphics cards? its an intel card
poo
can i ask a poll? what is better for you - GNOME, KDE, or XFCE?
i dont get XFCE, its too much like mac, and it has limited options ive found
what options are you missing?
i dont use it
but you get things missing like add/remove programs etc.
basic things included in ubuntu on gnome
you can run gnome-apps in xfce, without the weight of the full WM
i have to admit, linux does run better than windows in its own way
except when i was copying music to my mp3 player, it moved the music rather than copy generally because the root was thru /media
well thats one for XFCE and 1 for nothing lol
yay XFCE rocks
- hehe
i know this may seem stupid, but in what ways does a mac compare to ubuntu?
yeh, i like that
hydrogen is a good drum simulator
what do people prefer to play music?
or to have a library of music
